intro: Ptilotus floribundus, commonly known as the Christmas bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, branched stems and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant produces bright orange to red flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Ptilotus floribundus is a hardy shrub that is both ornamental and ecologically significant in its native habitat.
